verses.kjv: Woe unto them that decree unrighteous decrees, and that write grievousness which they have prescribed;
verses.ct: Disaster is coming for those who pass unjust laws and draft oppressive regulations,

verses.kjv: To turn aside the needy from judgment, and to take away the right from the poor of my people, that widows may be their prey, and that they may rob the fatherless!
verses.ct: denying justice to the vulnerable and stripping the rights of the poor among my people, making widows their targets and robbing orphans!

verses.kjv: And what will ye do in the day of visitation, and in the desolation which shall come from far? to whom will ye flee for help? and where will ye leave your glory?
verses.ct: What will you do when the day of punishment arrives, when destruction comes from far away? Who will you run to for help? Where will you hide your wealth?

verses.kjv: Without me they shall bow down under the prisoners, and they shall fall under the slain. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand is stretched out still.
verses.ct: Without me, they will only crouch among the captives or fall among the dead. Yet even after all this, his anger has not subsided, and his hand is still raised to strike.

verses.kjv: O Assyrian, the rod of mine anger, and the staff in their hand is mine indignation.
verses.ct: What trouble for Assyria, the club of my anger! The rod they carry represents my fury.

verses.kjv: I will send him against an hypocritical nation, and against the people of my wrath will I give him a charge, to take the spoil, and to take the prey, and to tread them down like the mire of the streets.
verses.ct: I am sending Assyria against a godless nation; I am ordering them against the people who have provoked my rage — to plunder them, to loot them, and to trample them like mud in the streets.

verses.kjv: Howbeit he meaneth not so, neither doth his heart think so; but it is in his heart to destroy and cut off nations not a few.
verses.ct: But that is not what the Assyrian king intends, and that is not what he has in mind. Instead, his goal is to destroy and wipe out many nations.

verses.kjv: For he saith, Are not my princes altogether kings?
verses.ct: He boasts, 'Aren't all my commanders as powerful as kings?'

verses.kjv: Is not Calno as Carchemish? is not Hamath as Arpad? is not Samaria as Damascus?
verses.ct: 'Isn't Calno just like Carchemish? Isn't Hamath the same as Arpad? Isn't Samaria no different from Damascus?'

verses.kjv: As my hand hath found the kingdoms of the idols, and whose graven images did excel them of Jerusalem and of Samaria;
verses.ct: 'My hand has seized kingdoms full of idols, nations whose carved images surpassed those of Jerusalem and Samaria.'

verses.kjv: Shall I not, as I have done unto Samaria and her idols, so do to Jerusalem and her idols?
verses.ct: 'Won't I do to Jerusalem and its idols exactly what I did to Samaria and its idols?'

verses.kjv: Wherefore it shall come to pass, that when the Lord hath performed his whole work upon mount Zion and on Jerusalem, I will punish the fruit of the stout heart of the king of Assyria, and the glory of his high looks.
verses.ct: Therefore, when the Lord has finished all his work against Mount Zion and Jerusalem, he will punish the arrogant boasting of the king of Assyria and the pride in his haughty eyes.

verses.kjv: For he saith, By the strength of my hand I have done it, and by my wisdom; for I am prudent: and I have removed the bounds of the people, and have robbed their treasures, and I have put down the inhabitants like a valiant man:
verses.ct: For the king says, 'I accomplished this by my own strength and wisdom, because I am clever. I erased the boundaries between nations, plundered their treasuries, and brought down their rulers like a mighty warrior.'

verses.kjv: And my hand hath found as a nest the riches of the people: and as one gathereth eggs that are left, have I gathered all the earth; and there was none that moved the wing, or opened the mouth, or peeped.
verses.ct: 'My hand reached into the wealth of nations as easily as reaching into a bird's nest. Like someone gathering abandoned eggs, I gathered the whole earth — and no one flapped a wing, opened a mouth, or made a sound.'

verses.kjv: Shall the axe boast itself against him that heweth therewith? or shall the saw magnify itself against him that shaketh it? as if the rod should shake itself against them that lift it up, or as if the staff should lift up itself, as if it were no wood.
verses.ct: Does an axe claim credit over the person swinging it? Does a saw act superior to the one pulling it? That would be like a stick trying to control the person lifting it, or a wooden staff trying to raise the one who carries it.

verses.kjv: Therefore shall the Lord, the Lord of hosts, send among his fat ones leanness; and under his glory he shall kindle a burning like the burning of a fire.
verses.ct: So the Lord, the LORD of Armies, will send a wasting disease among Assyria's strong warriors, and beneath their glory a fire will be kindled that burns and burns.

verses.kjv: And the light of Israel shall be for a fire, and his Holy One for a flame: and it shall burn and devour his thorns and his briers in one day;
verses.ct: The Light of Israel will become a fire, and his Holy One will become a flame. It will burn up and consume Assyria's thorns and briers in a single day.

verses.kjv: And shall consume the glory of his forest, and of his fruitful field, both soul and body: and they shall be as when a standard-bearer fainteth.
verses.ct: It will destroy the splendor of his forests and fertile fields completely — soul and body — like a sick person wasting away.

verses.kjv: And the rest of the trees of his forest shall be few, that a child may write them.
verses.ct: So few trees will remain in his forest that even a child could count them.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, that the remnant of Israel, and such as are escaped of the house of Jacob, shall no more again stay upon him that smote them; but shall stay upon the LORD, the Holy One of Israel, in truth.
verses.ct: When that day comes, the survivors of Israel and those who escaped from the house of Jacob will no longer depend on the nation that struck them down. Instead, they will truly depend on the LORD, the Holy One of Israel.

verses.kjv: The remnant shall return, even the remnant of Jacob, unto the mighty God.
verses.ct: A remnant will come back — the remnant of Jacob — to the mighty God.

verses.kjv: For though thy people Israel be as the sand of the sea, yet a remnant of them shall return: the consumption decreed shall overflow with righteousness.
verses.ct: Even though your people Israel are as numerous as the sand of the sea, only a remnant of them will return. Destruction has been decreed, and it will overflow with righteousness.

verses.kjv: For the Lord GOD of hosts shall make a consumption, even determined, in the midst of all the land.
verses.ct: For the Lord GOD of Armies will carry out the destruction that has been determined throughout the entire land.

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD of hosts, O my people that dwellest in Zion, be not afraid of the Assyrian: he shall smite thee with a rod, and shall lift up his staff against thee, after the manner of Egypt.
verses.ct: So this is what the Lord GOD of Armies says: 'My people living in Zion, don't be terrified of the Assyrians when they strike you with a rod and raise their staff against you, just as Egypt once did.'

verses.kjv: For yet a very little while, and the indignation shall cease, and mine anger in their destruction.
verses.ct: 'In just a little while, my fury will end, and my anger will turn to their destruction instead.'

verses.kjv: And the LORD of hosts shall stir up a scourge for him according to the slaughter of Midian at the rock of Oreb: and as his rod was upon the sea, so shall he lift it up after the manner of Egypt.
verses.ct: The LORD of Armies will raise a whip against Assyria, just as he defeated Midian at the rock of Oreb. He will stretch out his staff over the sea, just as he did against Egypt.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass in that day, that his burden shall be taken away from off thy shoulder, and his yoke from off thy neck, and the yoke shall be destroyed because of the anointing.
verses.ct: On that day, the Assyrian burden will be lifted from your shoulders, and their yoke will be removed from your neck. The yoke will be shattered because of the anointing.

verses.kjv: He is come to Aiath, he is passed to Migron; at Michmash he hath laid up his carriages:
verses.ct: The enemy has arrived at Aiath! He has passed through Migron! He has stored his supplies at Michmash!

verses.kjv: They are gone over the passage: they have taken up their lodging at Geba; Ramah is afraid; Gibeah of Saul is fled.
verses.ct: They have crossed through the pass and camped at Geba for the night. Ramah is trembling with fear. Gibeah of Saul has fled.

verses.kjv: Lift up thy voice, O daughter of Gallim: cause it to be heard unto Laish, O poor Anathoth.
verses.ct: Cry out, people of Gallim! Let your voice carry to Laish! Poor Anathoth!

verses.kjv: Madmenah is removed; the inhabitants of Gebim gather themselves to flee.
verses.ct: Madmenah's people have run away; the residents of Gebim are scrambling to escape.

verses.kjv: As yet shall he remain at Nob that day: he shall shake his hand against the mount of the daughter of Zion, the hill of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: This very day he will halt at Nob. He will shake his fist at the mountain of Zion's daughter, the hill of Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Behold, the Lord, the LORD of hosts, shall lop the bough with terror: and the high ones of stature shall be hewn down, and the haughty shall be humbled.
verses.ct: Look! The Lord, the LORD of Armies, will chop off the branches with terrifying power. The tallest trees will be cut down, and the lofty ones will be brought low.

verses.kjv: And he shall cut down the thickets of the forest with iron, and Lebanon shall fall by a mighty one.
verses.ct: He will hack through the dense forest with an iron axe, and Lebanon will fall before the Mighty One.
